properties.name: Crazy but promising
properties.description: Posted by NathanMontara is a steep beach break, so it tends to break hard and fast, and it can barrel. Better on a shortboard but I\'ve had fun on my longboard as well. There\'s a nice right at the north end of the beach on larger days. However, this break is chaotic, and often unsurfable.

properties.name: High-octane coffee and true love for the East Bay arts scene
properties.description: Posted by Nathan  2318 Telegraph Ave, Oakland, CAA gem on lower Telegraph and a nexus for art and ideas.

properties.name: Infrequent, but fun lefts when it's working
properties.description: Posted by Nathan This is the Eastern Bolinas break. It is usually pretty crappy, but I\'ve seen it get overhead here, and when it\'s actually breaking, it\'s fun and clean. Good on strong south swell, and very strong north swell.

properties.name: Like a pair of really confortable shoes
properties.description: Posted by NathanThe Jetty is a favorite spot of mine, not because it\'s a killer spot (although it can be), but because it\'s just a really nice place to be in the water. The main feature of the Jetty is the extreme north end, where swell refracts off of the jetty wall and jacks up in one crazy lump, breaking hard and peeling off to the right for a couple of tricks. After that, most shortboarders will pop off the back, where longboarders will try to get in to the reform and and some traditional moves to their fun drop-in. On a good day. Odds are, this break will be flat as a pancake when you arrive.

properties.name: Longboard left
properties.description: Posted by NathanBoat Docks (aka Botox) can be a great, peeling left, or it can be flat and onshore when the surf is small.

properties.name: Mossball Softball League
properties.description: Posted by Nathan 3612 webster oakland, caThe funnest Sunday softball game in the Bay Area for three years running. You have to know someone to play, but in the East Bay, everybody knows everybody anyway.

properties.name: My Poor Old House
properties.description: Posted by Nathan3127 Telegraph oakland, caI lived on this block for two years. I loved it here, even though our house was run-down and yucky and the bathroom ceiling fell in and raccoon pee seeped through the sub-ceiling (I shit you not, and they, the raccoons, used to have full-on Wrestle Mania right above my head as I tried to fall asleep at night). But it was a really neat old house in an awesome location (i.e. Oakland) and I miss it. And some of my stuff is still there.

properties.name: My hood
properties.description: Posted by NathanOK, I haven\'t actually paddled out here, but I check the conditions here often: grab a coffee and Java Beach and walk across great highway. Or if that\'s too much effort, I can see the break from my living room window on a clear day.

properties.name: Pro Mess
properties.description: Posted by Nathan 1740 Cesar Chavez # 2, San Francisco, CAThe first and the last messenger company I worked for. Made pretty good money, but I hear that the Empire offered Imperial Stormtroopers a pretty progessive pay structure as well. Great place to work if you like power-hungry unions, power-hungry union-busters and weird corporate culture. Full disclosure: I never forgave this company for buying out Silver Bullet.

properties.name: Shark bait
properties.description: Posted by NathanStinson is a long, straight beach break that is closed out 9 days out of 10. Save your gas, and disregard the surf websites that seem to think this break has good days.

properties.name: Soft, sometimes-peeling rights for longboarding
properties.description: Posted by Nathan One of two breaks in Bolinas, the Patch is often frustratingly tame, but its rocky bottom makes it more reliable than some area beach breaks. Don\'t bother bringing your shortboard to surf here. Your longboard will serve you well; the Patch occasionally serves up great waves to walk around on.

properties.name: The cafe at the End of the World...
properties.description: Posted by Nathan   1396 La Playa St, San Francisco, CA...or at least at the end of the Western World. Java Beach is a great place to get a cup of coffee or a beer, although not always a good place to find a seat. More or less packed from morning \'til night, JB is pretty much the neighborhood cafe for the entire northwest Sunset.

properties.name: The canonical OB break
properties.description: Posted by NathanThis is the place that most people are talking about when they\'re talking about surfing Ocean Beach. A super-exposed, shifty beach break, Sloat ranges from closed out foam, to mellow summer rollers to plunging, overhead barrels. This can be a dangerous place to surf if you\'re not terribly experienced (like me), but if the conditions are right, it\'s exactly what a beach break is supposed to be: nice A-frames with peeling rights and lefts, flanked by convenient channels for paddling out unmolested.

properties.name: Top of Ocean Beach
properties.description: Posted by Nathan  Been out here once. The north end of Ocean Beach is usually messier than the south end, due to its closer proximity to the mouth of the bay and its strong, shifting currents. However, if conditions at the south end are non-ideal, it\'s worth checking the north.
